TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ICustomTypeDescriptor

Docs.summary: Provides an interface that supplies dynamic custom type information for an object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ICustomTypeDescriptor interface allows an object to provide type information about itself. Typically, this interface is used when an object needs dynamic type information. In contrast, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class provides static type information that is obtained from metadata.
For example, ICustomTypeDescriptor is used in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] to provide type information for COM objects. COM objects do not support properties or attributes. Therefore, the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] uses ICustomTypeDescriptor to implement properties and attributes for COM objects.
To provide dynamic custom type information, a class can implement ICustomTypeDescriptor or derive from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CustomTypeDescriptor> class, which provides a simple implementation of this interface.
> [!NOTE] > There is no design-time support for data binding to objects that implement the ICustomTypeDescriptor interface. In addition, when binding to a runtime instance of ICustomTypeDescriptor, the public properties of the underlying type are ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection GetAttributes ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection GetAttributes() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a collection of custom attributes for this instance of a component.
Docs.returns: An containing the attributes for this object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The return value is never `null`.
Implementers can return an empty <xref:System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection> if no custom attributes are specified for an object.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetClassName ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetClassName() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the class name of this instance of a component.
Docs.returns: The class name of the object, or if the class does not have a name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `null` is returned, use the type name from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetComponentName%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetComponentName ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetComponentName() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the name of this instance of a component.
Docs.returns: The name of the object, or if the object does not have a name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `null` is returned, use the default name.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter GetConverter ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter GetConverter() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a type converter for this instance of a component.
Docs.returns: A that is the converter for this object, or if there is no for this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `null` is returned, use the default <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter>.

Docs.returns: An that represents the default event for this object, or if this object does not have events.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor GetDefaultProperty ();

Docs.summary: Returns the default property for this instance of a component.
Docs.returns: A that represents the default property for this object, or if this object does not have properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public object GetEditor (Type editorBaseType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetEditor(class System.Type editorBaseType) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Type> that represents the editor for this object.
Docs.summary: Returns an editor of the specified type for this instance of a component.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Object> of the specified type that is the editor for this object, or if the editor cannot be found.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The type of the `editorBaseType` parameter is usually <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor>, but you can also use other types (for example, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ComponentEditor> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.InstanceCreationEditor>).

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection GetEvents ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection GetEvents() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the events for this instance of a component.
Docs.returns: An that represents the events for this component instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The events for this instance can differ from the set of events that the class provides. For example, if the component is site-based, the site can add or remove additional events.
Implementors can return <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection?displayProperty=fullName> if no properties are specified. This method should never return `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection GetEvents (Attribute[] attributes);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection GetEvents(class System.Attribute[] attributes) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of type <xref:System.Attribute> that is used as a filter.
Docs.summary: Returns the events for this instance of a component using the specified attribute array as a filter.
Docs.returns: An that represents the filtered events for this component instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The events for this instance can differ from the set of events that the class provides. For example, if the component is site-based, the site can add or remove additional events.
If an <xref:System.Attribute> is specified in the `attributes` array and the event does not have an instance of the class for that attribute, the returned array includes the event if the <xref:System.Attribute> is the default event.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection GetProperties ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection GetProperties() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the properties for this instance of a component.
Docs.returns: A that represents the properties for this component instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The properties for this instance can differ from the set of properties that the class provides. For example, if the component is sited, the site can add or remove additional properties.
Implementers can return <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection?displayProperty=fullName> if no properties are specified. This method should never return `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection GetProperties (Attribute[] attributes);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection GetProperties(class System.Attribute[] attributes) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of type <xref:System.Attribute> that is used as a filter.
Docs.summary: Returns the properties for this instance of a component using the attribute array as a filter.
Docs.returns: A that represents the filtered properties for this component instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The properties for this instance can differ from the set of properties that the class provides. For example, if the component is sited, the site can add or remove additional properties.
If an <xref:System.Attribute> is specified in the `attributes` array and the property does not have an instance of the class for that attribute, the returned collection will include the property if the <xref:System.Attribute> is the default property.
For filtering rules, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public object GetPropertyOwner (System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor pd);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetPropertyOwner(class System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor pd) cil managed

Docs.param: A that represents the property whose owner is to be found.
Docs.summary: Returns an object that contains the property described by the specified property descriptor.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Object> that represents the owner of the specified property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetPropertyOwner method retrieves the object that contains the property member that is described by <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> parameter. Typically, this object is required for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor.GetValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor.SetValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods.
This method should return an object that you can use as follows:
``` pd.GetValue(GetPropertyOwner(myPd)); ```
If `myPd` is `null`, your implementation of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface should return the default object (typically, the base object that exposes the properties and attributes).
